content.title: Coir Vikas Yojana- Coir Industry Technology Upgradation Scheme
content.department: Ministry Of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises
content.details: The scheme 'Coir Industry Technology Upgradation Scheme (CITUS)' is a component of the 'Coir Vikas Yojana' and was launched by the Ministry of Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises, Government of India. The objectives include providing modern infrastructure facilities, supporting new coir processing units, promoting employment opportunities, and modernizing existing coir units.
benefits: Financial assistance for procurement of eligible Plants and Machinery for modernization and establishing new units.
25% of the cost of admissible items of Plant and Machinery procured.
Upper ceiling of financial assistance is ₹2.50 crore per coir unit/project.
Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) mode for financial assistance.
eligibility: Newly established coir production/processing units in various categories including individuals, partnerships, SHGs, and enterprises.
Units registered with the Coir Board under Coir Industry (Registration) Rules, 2008, and having Udyog Aadhar.
Units must have completed 5 years of successful operation before applying for assistance.
exclusions: Single unit/enterprise will not be allowed for grant of assistance.
No applications from units exceeding investment limits prescribed for medium-scale enterprises.
documents_required: Details of Registration under Coir Board Registration Rules 2008
PAN & Aadhaar Number of the Applicant
Attested copies of bills and payment receipts for machinery procurement
Details of IPA received from Coir Board
Copy of the sanction letter from the bank/financial institution

faqs.question: What is CITUS Scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme 'Coir Industry Technology Upgradation Scheme (CITUS)' is a component of the 'Coir Vikas Yojana' launched by the Ministry of Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises, Government of India.

faqs.question: What is the objective of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The objectives include providing modern infrastructure facilities, supporting new coir processing units, promoting employment opportunities, and modernizing existing coir units.

faqs.question: Which is the implementing agency of this scheme?
Who are eligible for the assistance under the scheme CITUS?
faqs.answer: Assistance is available to entrepreneurs in various categories interested in producing value-added coir items.

faqs.question: Is it necessary for Coir Unit to register with the Coir Board?
faqs.answer: Yes, all coir production/processing units must be registered with the Coir Board.

faqs.question: What is the nature of assistance provided under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Financial assistance of 25% of the cost of admissible items of Plant and Machinery.

faqs.question: How to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Submit a Detailed project report (DPR) in the prescribed format to the nearest ROs/SROs of the Board through online.
